simple.escp.dom.line

Class TableLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.dom.Line
      • simple.escp.dom.line.TableLine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<TableColumn>

    public class TableLine
extends Line
implements java.lang.Iterable<TableColumn>
    DOM class to represent table. A table consists of one or more TableColumn.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableLine

        public TableLine(java.lang.String source)
        Create a new TableLine.
        Parameters:
        source - a placeholder text to retrieve data source for this table. It should be evaluated to a Collection during filling.

    • Method Detail

        public java.lang.String getSource()

        Returns:
        data source for this table.

      • addColumn

        public TableColumn addColumn(TableColumn column)
        Add a new TableColumn to this table.
        Parameters:
        column - a new TableColumn that will be appended at the right-most position.
        Returns:
        the new TableColumn.

      • addColumn

        public TableColumn addColumn(java.lang.String text,
                    int width)
        Add a new TableColumn to this table.
        Parameters:
        text - the text, may contains placeholder, for this column.
        width - width of this column in number of characters.
        Returns:
        the new TableColumn.

        public int getNumberOfColumns()

      • getColumnAt

        public TableColumn getColumnAt(int index)
        Get a column based on index.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of column starting. The left-most column has index 1, the next column is 2, and so on.
        Returns:
        the TableColumn at index position.

      • isDynamic

        public boolean isDynamic()
        Defines wether this line is a dynamic line or not. A dynamic line is a line that will be expanded later when filling this line with data. For example, a table line is a dynamic line because number of lines for that table can't be defined in parsing step. It requires the actual value to define the actual number of lines.
        Specified by:
        isDynamic in class Line
        Returns:
        true if this is a dynamic line or false if otherwise.

      • isDrawBorder

        public boolean isDrawBorder()
        Determine if this table line should have border drawn around it. Drawing border will reduce the width of every columns by one character. It also will increase number of lines required by the table.
        Returns:
        true if this TableLine has border.

      • setDrawBorder

        public void setDrawBorder(boolean drawBorder)
        Set wether to enable drawing solid border for this table line or not.
        Parameters:
        drawBorder - true to enable border for this table.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get width of lines in this table in number of characters.
        Returns:
        width in number of characters.

      • getHeader

        public TextLine[] getHeader()
        Retrieve the header for this table. If border for this table is disabled, header will only be a row that contains column's caption. If border is enabled, the header is three lines with CP347 pseudo-graphic characters to simulate a border.
        Returns:
        the definition of header.

      • getFooter

        public TextLine[] getFooter()
        Retrieve the footer for this table.
        Returns:
        the definition of footer.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<TableColumn> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<TableColumn>
